concept.title: Validation for Predefined Product Groups

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: On activating an agreement or clicking the product group member needs to be performed at the SKU level. Conditions for validation include preventing overlapping members and ensuring SKU-level validation for product group membership.

othermeta.name: entities
othermeta.content: product-group; sku; program; agreement; qualification; benefit

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: validation and configuration of predefined product groups within incentive programs

conbody.p: On activating an agreement or clicking the Validate button on an agreement, you have the flexibility of offering a different type of program to a dynamic combination of products, product categories which not lead to duplicate billing records. Validation of product group member needs to be performed at the SKU level.

ul.li: You cannot add categories/products with overlapping dates for the same product and category within the same product group.

If you choose to exclude products from a category, you can add the excluded product to the product group with start date and end date overlapping the start date and end date of the category.
If the validation conditions are not satisfied, an error message appears as follows "Product group member {name} overlaps with product group member {name}".
Customer Incentive Manager doesn't perform duplicate product group member validation across product groups.

conbody.note: If the product group is updated within 2 hours of schedule calculation in which it is used, the user must wait for 2 hours before calculating the schedule again manually or through a scheduled job for the CIM to use the latest product group definition for calculation purposes. If the user amends and activates the agreement, the CIM uses the latest product group definition for open schedule calculations.
